column4: Start the Live CD and choose the 'memtest' option from the boot menu.  A random frequent crash with a signal often means bad memory or a bad cpu.
thanks. I think that may be it. when I start multitasking is when it seems to happen
I'll give memtest a try. does memtest offer a way to fix the problems that may exist?
Memtest gives you a list of bad memory cells.  You can make an educated guess and replace a flakey DIMM.   If the CPU is bad, then memtest will just crash the computer.
